page.title: 15PARK FARM BLENHEIM WOODSTOCK
page.content: Blenheim estate owns 11,500 acres of land, Park Farm farms 3,800 acres of this including 800 acres of amenity woodland and 1,000 acres of commercial woodland. The part of their farm which is in our area is mainly used for sheep, this land goes to make up their 1,700 acres of grassland. They also grow barley and rape. They employ 5 herdsmen and 1 relief herdsman, 1 shepherd, 1 stockwoman and 8 tractor drivers. They own 8 tractors, 2 loaders, 4 muck spreaders and 5 combines. They have 600 fresian cows, and 1.100 ewes who produce 2,000 lambs a year. They try to avoid using too many chemicals because of the expense but they have to use fungicides because their use of nitrogen makes the plants more prone to disease. The rape has to be sprayed once with an insecticide. The tourits are not a problem to them.
